words.definition: An alliance is a group of people who work together.
words.example: The junior executives formed an alliance with each other.

words.definition: Applause is the noise made when people clap hands to show approval.
words.example: At the end of his speech, everyone gave applause.

words.definition: If you are armed, you are carrying a weapon.
words.example: The robber was armed with a gun.

words.definition: If something is authoritative, it uses the best information available.
words.example: This book is an authoritative source on Ancient Egypt.

words.definition: A ceremony is an event that happens on special occasions.
words.example: Tom and Amyâ€™s marriage ceremony is in June.

words.definition: Culture is the music, art, and writings of a certain place or group of people.
words.example: Ancient Mexican culture is renowned for its architecture.

words.definition: A defense is something that is done to protect another thing.
words.example: The air force works in defense of its country.

words.definition: A detail is a small piece of information.
words.example: Jane told Ben all the details of her trip to China.

words.definition: When a group of things is diverse, it is made up of a wide variety of things.
words.example: Big cities have diverse populations with people of different races and ages.

words.definition: To enchant someone is to make them feel very interested or happy.
words.example: The beautiful woman enchanted everybody in the room.

words.definition: To equip someone is to give them the things they need.
words.example: The company will equip its workers with new laptops.

words.definition: An exception is someone or something that does not fit into a general rule.
words.example: Most students passed the test, but there were a few exceptions.

words.definition: A genre is a particular type of writing, art, or music.
words.example: Science fiction is my favorite genre of books.

words.definition: An impact is the effect that something has on another person or thing.
words.example: The new law had a huge impact on the economy.

words.definition: To lure someone is to trick them into going somewhere or doing something.
words.example: The smell of food lured the dog into the kitchen.

words.definition: An obstacle is something that stops you from doing something.
words.example: The mountain was a major obstacle to the explorers.

words.definition: A shelter is a place to be safe from bad weather or danger.
words.example: They found shelter from the rain under a large tree.

words.definition: To sort means to separate things into different groups.
words.example: I sorted the laundry into white and colored clothes.

words.definition: To supply means to give someone something they need or want.
words.example: The farm supplies the local market with fresh vegetables.

words.definition: If something is in vain, it is done without success.
words.example: He tried in vain to fix the broken computer.
